cards.back_flavor: Bark Harrigan is the best of the best. Trained in paw-to-paw combat and barksmanship, he takes pride in being a protector of humanity. A shield against the feline forces that threaten to invade the world. But will his weapons and skills be enough? Or is he all bark and no bite?
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, [[Weapon]] cards level 0 Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Catling Gun, More Bark Than Bite, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.name: Bark Harrigan
cards.text:
You have 2 additional paw slots which can only be used to hold [[Weapon]] assets. Yes, that's right. You heard me. Don't ask how.
[elder_sign] effect: +2. Reduce the cost of the next [[Weapon]] asset you play this round by 2.

cards.name: Catling Gun
cards.text: Bark Harrigan deck only. Uses (12 ammo). [action][action] Spend 1-3 ammo: Fight. You get +X [combat] and deal +X damage for this attack. X is the amount of ammo spent as part of this ability's cost.

cards.name: More Bark Than Bite
cards.text: Revelation - Put More Bark Than Bite into play in your threat area. You get -3 [combat]. (BARK! BARK! BARK!) Forced - After you defeat an enemy: Discard More Bark Than Bite.

cards.back_flavor: One of the brightest in Muttskatonic University Obedience School, Kate is an expert in theoretical physics, chemistry, and zoology. Thanks to her keen mind and attention to detail, she has concocted a way to defend herself and others from the machinations of cats everywhere. Using her newly constructed Feline Discombobulator - and her keen sense of smell - Kate will sniff out evil and defend Barkham from the forces that dwell in the shadows.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to five other level 0 cards that look like they would smell weird. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Feline Discombobulator, Foul Odor, 1 random basic weakness.

deck_options.error: You cannot have more than 5 cards that are not Seeker or Neutral

cards.name: Kate Winthpup
cards.text:
While you are at a location you've sniffed, each skill test you perform gets -1 difficulty.
[action]: Sniff your location or a connecting location. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
[elder_sign] effect: +0. Sniff your location or a connecting location.

cards.name: Feline Discombobulator
cards.text:
Kate Winthpup deck only.
[reaction] When an enemy would spawn at your location, if that enemy is a cat, looks like a cat, or is some kind of weird cat-person hybrid, exhaust Feline Discombobulator: Automatically evade it.

cards.name: Foul Odor
cards.text: Revelation - Put Foul Odor into play in your threat area. Forced - After you perofrm a skill test at a location you have sniffed: Take 1 horror. [action]: Discard Foul Odor and unsniff everything you've sniffed.

cards.back_flavor: "Skids" O'Drool always wanted to be a good boy. But his nose for trouble kept landing him in the pound, where the "bad dogs" go. Usually this was because of his favorite pastime: begging to go for a car ride, then fervently wrenching the wheel away from the hapless human. How this obsession with cars began, we may never know. All we know is that other drivers should be careful when "Skids" is on the loose.
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to five other level 0 cards that "move" you (and by "move" we mean physically, not emotionally). Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Take the Wheel, Dogcatchers, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.name: "Skids" O'Drool
cards.text: [action]: Spend 1 resource: Move. You give a human puppy dog eyes until they give you a car ride. Move up to 3 times, ignoring enemy engagement. (Limit once per round.) [elder_sign] effect: +2. Deal 1 damage to the next enemy whose location you enter this round.

cards.name: Take the Wheel
cards.text:
"Skids" O'Drool deck only.
Fast. Play only during your turn.
For the remainder of your turn, whenever you enter a location, deal 3 damage to an enemy at that location.
cards.traits: What? No. Stop. That's bad. Bad dog.

cards.name: Dogcatchers
cards.text: Prey - "Skids" O'Drool. Hunter. Forced - After you enter Dogcatchers' location or Dogcatchers enters your location: You cannot move for the remainder of the round.

cards.back_flavor: As a psychic, Jacqueline Canine can always foretell what is buried beneath the earth in any given spot. She knows where to go to find the best bones, where to rummage to find the tastiest scraps of food, and where to beg for the best treats. But what will Jacqueline do when these premonitions lead her to real danger?
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, level 0-5 cards that are cats or have cats in their artwork. (Blasphemy!) Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Chew Toy of Nightmares, No Sense of Space or Time, 1 random basic weakness.
cards.name: Jacqueline Canine
cards.text:
[fast] Bury 1 card from your hand facedown beneath Jacqueline Canine: Draw 1 card. (Limit once per round.)
[action]: Choose and dig up 1 or 2 buried cards, returning them to your hand.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. Dig up a buried card, returning it to your hand.

cards.flavor: Once you start chewing, you can never stop.
cards.illustrator: E. P. Harris, J. L. Johnson
cards.name: Chew Toy of Nightmares
cards.text:
Jacqueline Canine deck only.
You may commit buried cards to skill tests as if they were in your hand.

cards.name: No Sense of Space or Time
cards.text: Revelation - Oh no! You forgot where you buried all your cards! For each card you have buried, either take 1 horror or discard it.

cards.back_flavor: Arf. Arf arf arf. BARK! Grrrrrrrr. Woof. Arf arf arf arf arf arf arf. Bark bark. Mrr?... Bark. Bark bark. Arf arf arf arf arf. Borf borf. Woof woof woof! AROOOOOOO-
cards.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to five other level 0 [[Ally]] cards who are either other dogs or humans who want to put you. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Friendly Human, Out of Doggie Treats, 1 random basic weakness.

deck_options.error: You cannot have more than 5 cards that are not Survivor or Neutral

cards.name: Duke
cards.text:
You begin the game with Friendly Human in play.
[action][action]: You beg for more treats. Place 3 treats on Friendly Human.
[elder_sign] effect: +2. Place 1 treat on Friendly Human. After this test ends, ready him.

cards.name: Friendly Human
cards.text:
Duke deck only. Uses (5 treats).
[reaction] After you succeed at a skill test, spend 1 treat: Good boy! Either (choose one) -
- Heal 1 damage or 1 horror.
- Draw 1 card
- Gain 1 resource.

cards.flavor:
...but I did good!
Didn't I do good?
I did good, right?
... right?
cards.name: Out of Doggie Treats
cards.text: Revelation - Remove all treats from Friendly Human.

cards.name: Spiked Collar
cards.text:
Barkham deck only.
[reaction] When an enemy attack deals damage to you, exhaust Spiked Collar: Deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy.

cards.name: Dog Monocle
cards.text:
Barkham deck only.
You get +1 [intellect] while investigating and also +1 skill value during parley actions, because, I mean, honestly, look at you.

cards.flavor: Is it weird for a dog to hire another dog?
cards.name: Hired Dogs
cards.text: Barkham deck only. [fast] During your turn, exhaust Hired Dogs: Fight/Investigate. Either attack with a base [combat] skill of 4, or investigate with a base [intellect] skill of 4. After this test ends, either pay 1 resource in dog food or discard hired dogs.

cards.flavor: While not strictly an Ancient One, Clyhf'ford is most definitely a kaiju.
cards.illustrator: A. J. Manzanedo, J. L. Johnson
cards.name: Howl of Clyhf'ford
cards.text: Barkham deck only. Evade. The enemy chosen for this evasion attempt must be the enemy in play with the highest evade value. This evasion attempt uses [intellect] instead of [combat]. If you succeed, automatically evade each non-[[Elite]] enemy in play.

cards.flavor: It's like a chew toy, but smellier!
cards.name: Old Shoe
cards.text:
Barkham deck only.
[fast] Deal 1 damage to Old Shoe: Heal 1 horror.

cards.flavor: Go home dog, you are drunk.
cards.name: Hair of the Dog
cards.text:
Barkham deck only. Max 1 committed per skill test.
After this skill test ends, the investigator performing this test gets -2 skill value for the next skill test they perform this round.

cards.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is the number of [[Meowsk]] enemies in play, in the victory display, and attached to Meowlathotep.
[cultist]: -2. Place 1 doom on the nearest enemy.
[tablet]: -2. Place 1 of your clues on your location.
[elder_thing]: -7. Woof.
cards.name: The Meddling of Meowlathotep
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of [[Meowsk]] enemies in play, in the victory display, and attached to Meowlathotep, rounded up.
[cultist]: -2. If you fail, place 1 doom on the nearest enemy.
[tablet]: -2. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location.
[elder_thing]: -5. Woof.

cards.back_flavor: The summoning is complete! Now one of the "Meowsks" of Meowlathotep prowls the streets of Barkham. It is up to you to put an end to this menace before its true master is unveiled.
cards.back_text:
If no locations are lousy with cats, advance to agenda 2a.
If at least 1 location is lousy with cats, find the one that is farthest from all investigators. Flip the card beneath that location over and spawn it at that location. Reset the agenda deck to agenda 1a.
cards.flavor: You're hot on the trail of a cat conspiracy. A catspiracy, if you will.
cards.name: Of Cats and Dogs
cards.text:
[fast] Investigators at a location that is lousy with cats spend 2 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Add the card beneath that location to the victory display.
[action] If you are at a location that is lousy with cats: Flip the card beneath that location over and spawn it at that location, exhausted.

cards.back_flavor: You have run out of time. The Order's ritual is complete. Now there is nothing that can be done to stop Meowlathotep from dismantling this world and creating a paradise for felinekind. A world without doors, with endless birds to chase, posts to scratch, and sunlight to lounge in. A world with no dogs.
cards.flavor: The Prowling Chaos treads upon the Earth once more! Its hiss shakes the foundations of the city. Its screech shatters windows and rends living creatures whole. Its purr - well, okay, its purr is pretty adorable, but everything else is really bad.
cards.name: Meowlathotep's Scheme

cards.back_flavor: You have forced the Order's paw. Now their true master, the Prowling Chaos, has emerged. Can you even hope to stop this awful creature?
cards.back_text:
Spawn the set-aside Meowlathotep enemy at a [[Central]] location of your choice.
For each [[Meowsk]] enemy in play, attach that enemy facedown to Meowlathotep. Now Meowlathotep is the one who is lousy with cats!
Advance to act 2a and agenda 2a.
cards.flavor: Dogs all across town report seeing strange cats prowling around several locations in Barkham. Perhaps if you investigate these areas, you can root out the cat-monsters that dwell within.
cards.name: Nine Lives
cards.text: Objective - At the start of the investigation phase, if no locations are lousy with cats, advance.

cards.back_flavor: As the entity known as Meowlathotep collapses, its body dissolves into the shadows from whence it emerged. You know that one day the Order of Dead Rodents on the Doorstep will try to revive their master once more... but for now, at least, Barkham is safe. You let out a fierce howl to let the rest of the dogs in the city know of your victory. Within moments, the sky is filled with the triumphant howls of dogs everywhere. All across Barkham, humans look on in confusion, thinking: "Why is my dog active weird?"
cards.flavor: There must be a way to destroy this cat abomination for good! Maybe catnip? A cardboard box? A length of string?
cards.name: The Cat and the Mouse
cards.text: [action] Spend 1 clue: Deal 2 damage to an enemy at your location, or 1 damage without provoking attacks of opportunity. Objective - If Meowlathotep is defeated, advance.

cards.back_flavor: Be cautious where you walk in Beasttown. You never know what you might step in.
cards.name: Beasttown
cards.text: [fast] Spend 2 resources: You follow a weird scent heading south. Move to Slobbertown. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.back_flavor: Where you go when you need to se a dog about a man.
cards.flavor: Catching a train here is about as difficult as catching your own tail.
cards.name: Tailside
cards.text: [fast] Spend 2 resources: You pursue a raccoon for no reason. Move to Beasttown. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.back_flavor: They've got a lid on every trashcan and a fence around every tree.
cards.name: Snoutside
cards.text: [fast] Spend 2 resources: You chase a delivery truck to the north. Move to Tailside. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.back_flavor: The banks of the Muttskatonic River are lined with warehouses and stores, filled with exotic treats from around the world.
cards.flavor: Take one whiff of the air here and you'll quickly understand how the neighborhood got its name.
cards.name: Slobbertown
cards.text: [fast] Spend 2 resources: Barkham has no leash laws! You take yourself for a walk. Move to Snoutside. (Group limit once per round.)

cards.back_flavor: While baying at the moon is a fairly common occurrence in Barkham, the howls that escape the Asylum are... unnatural.
cards.name: Barkham Asylum
cards.text: [action]: Heal 3 horror. (Limit once per game.) [action]: Take 1 horror: Parley. You overhear a strange way of barking. Baroo! Baroo! Catthulhu woofthagn! Test [willpower] (4) to learn how to bark that way too. If you succeed, remember that you "learned the bark of the outer gods."

cards.back_flavor: Both dogs and ghouls agree: Bones are delicious.
cards.name: Boneyard
cards.text:
[reaction] After you successfully investigate Boneyard by 2 or more: Place 1 resource on Boneyard, as a bone. (What did you expect?)
[action] If there are 1 [per_investigator] bones on Boneyard: Nice! That's a lot of bones! Remove them and remember that you "buried the bones a few meters from where you found them."

cards.back_flavor: Only the smartest and goodest pups make it into the Muttskatonic University Obedience School. There, students can earn dogtorates in advanced mathematics, fine art, and not being afraid of the vacuum cleaner.
cards.name: Muttskatonic University
cards.text:
[action]: Draw 3 cards. (Limit once per game.)
[action] Discard cards from your hand with a total of at least 3 [intellect] skill icons on them: Remember that you "brushed up on cat physiology."

cards.back_flavor: You ain't nothing' but a pound dog.
cards.name: Barkham City Pound
cards.text: [action]: Gain 3 resources. (Limit once per game.) [action] Spend 1 resource: Parley.Test [agility] (4) to convince the employees to part with some cat toys by acting adorable. If you succeed, remember that you "possess a ball of yarn."

cards.back_flavor:
"We're going for a car ride," they said.
"It'll be fun," they said.
cards.name: St. Mary's Animal Hospital
cards.text: [action]: Heal 3 danage. You're not happy about it though. (Limit once per game.) [action] Take 1 damage: Parley. Test [intellect] (4) to schedule a visit to the vet for a cat. This is physically painful for you. If you succeed, remember that "a cat has an appointment with the vet."

cards.back_flavor:
It's got the best kibble in town.
No doggie bags allowed, of course.
cards.name: Velma's Doghouse
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (5). You beg and beg and beg. If you succeed, remember that you "scored some tasty food." You also take some for yourself; heal 1 damage and 1 horror.

cards.name: Meowlathotep
cards.text:
Hunter.
Meowlathotep gets +1 [per_investigator] health for each [[Meowsk]] enemy attached to it.
Meowlathotep gets +1 fight and +1 evade for every 2 [[Meowsk]] enemies attached to it.
While there are 3 or more [[Meowsk]] enemies attached to it, Meowlathotep gains retaliate and alert.

cards.name: The Hisser in the Dark
cards.text: Alert. Hunter. This enemy gets +1 [per_investigator] health. Forced - While The Hisser in the Dark is engaged with you, if you enter and leave each of the [[Central]] locations in one turn: It becomes extremely dizzy. Add it to the victory display.

cards.name: Cat of Tindalos
cards.text: Hunter. Retaliate. This enemy gets +1 [per_investigator] health. [action] If you "possess a ball of yarn": Parley. You throw the ball of yarn into a perfect 90 degree corner. The Cat of Tindalos predictably follows into an extradimensional pocket. Add it to the victory display.

cards.name: The Dweller in the Deep
cards.text: Alert. Hunter. This enemy gets +1 [per_investigator] health. [action] If you "brushed up on cat physiology": Parley. You inform the Dweller in the Deep that it has no gills and therefore cannot breathe underwater. The universe self-corrects for the paradox and Dweller in the Deep ceases to exist. Add it to the victory display.

cards.name: The Mewling Hunger
cards.text: Hunter. This enemy gets +1 [per_investigator] health. [action] If you "scored some tasty food": Parley. The hungry twins have been placated. They curl up happily in a box and fall asleep. Add this enemy to the victory display.

cards.name: GHOST CAT!
cards.subname: Cat That is Also a Ghost
cards.text: Alert. Hunter. This enemy gets +1 [per_investigator] health. [action] If you "buried the bones a few meters from where you found them": Parley. Oh. That's what those were. Well that's sad. Still, the cat's spirit is appeased. Add this enemy to the victory display.

cards.name: Cat Riding on a Byakat
cards.subname: It's Exactly What it Sounds Like
cards.text: Hunter. This enemy gets +1 [per_investigator] health. [action] If you "learned the bark of the outer gods": Parley. You perform the aforementioned bark. The byakat flies off, but the other cat stays. Add this enemy to the victory display. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for an Estranged Cat and spawn it at your location.

cards.name: Pouncer in the Night
cards.text: Hunter. Retaliate. This enemy gets +1 [per_investigator] health. [action] If "a cat has an appointment with the vet": Parley. What? Oh, heck no. The cat flees in absolute terror. Add this enemy to the victory display.

cards.name: Estranged Cat
cards.text: Spawn - Any empty location. Forced - After Estranged Cat enters play: Place 1 doom on it. Forced - When Estranged Cat would be defeated: It runs away to the discard pile, but isn't injured at all (please, I'm not a monster).

cards.name: Rodent-Killer
cards.text: Prey - Investigator nearest to a card that is lousy with cats. Hunter.

cards.name: Order Cultist
cards.text: Spawn - Any empty location. Retaliate. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: Place 1 doom on Order Cultist.

cards.flavor: "Stop trying to make fetch happen. It's not going to happen."
cards.name: Servant of Dog-Sothoth
cards.text: Spawn - Location with the most enemies (including facedown encounter cards). Alert. Retaliate.

cards.name: SQUIRREL!
cards.text: Revelation - IT'S A SQUIRREL! You must chase it! Test [agility] (4). For each point you fail by, lose 1 action.

cards.name: Hunted by Byakats
cards.text: Revelation - Put Hunted by Byakats into play in your threat area. As an additional cost to perform any of the following actions (move, fight, or investigate), you must spend 1 resource in cat food to appease the pursuing Byakats. Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, discard Hunted by Byakats.

cards.flavor: Get it? Your tail? ...but seriously, they're right behind you.
cards.name: On Your Tail
cards.text: Revelation - If there are no enemies in play, On Your Tail gains surge. Otherwise, place 1 doom on the nearest enemy to you and test [agility] (X), where X is that enemy's evade value. If you fail, that enemy attacks you.

cards.name: Cats in the Mist
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 horror.

cards.flavor: There are no nailclippers in the chthonian depths beneath Barkham.
cards.name: Scratching Paws
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 damage.

cards.name: Meowsks of Meowlathotep
cards.text: Revelation - If... - ...Meowlathotep is in play, it attacks each investigator, in player order. - ...at least 1 location is lousy with cats, choose one of those locations. Flip the card beneath that location over and spawn it at that location. - ...neither is true, this card gains surge.

cards.name: Stubborn Cat
cards.text: Revelation - Attach to the location in play with the most clues. A cat is laying on all of the evidence a this location. You obviously cannot investigate attached location. [action]: Test [willpower] (4) or [agility] (4) to shoo the cat away. If you succeed, discard Stubborn Cat.

cards.name: Mischief and Chaos
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, choose an asset you control and slowly push it until it falls off the table (if you cannot, take 2 damage instead). Cards that fall off the table in this way are removed from the game.

cards.name: Gaze of the Ceiling Cat
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (5). For each point you fail by, either lose 1 resource or choose and discard 1 card from your hand. If this effect forces you to lose all of your resources and discard all of your cards, you feel really creeped out.
